definition: to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: The mayor was criticized for his indecisiveness.
sentences.chinese: 市長的優柔寡斷受到了批評。

sentences.english: He had lost all that dreamy vagueness and indecision.
sentences.chinese: 過去的夢遊似的迷迷糊糊和優柔寡斷早已不在。

sentences.english: And time yet for a hundred indecisions.
sentences.chinese: 時間裏也有一百種優柔寡斷。

sentences.english: Japan’s emperor Hirohito tragically vacillated over the war.
sentences.chinese: 日本天皇裕仁對戰爭的優柔寡斷是悲劇性的。

sentences.english: He takes after his father in being weak-minded.
It merely means you’re indecisive and let others make decisions for you.
sentences.chinese: 它僅僅代表你優柔寡斷，讓別人來給你做決定。

sentences.english: The second enemy we face is  indecision.
sentences.chinese: 我們面臨的第二個敵人是優柔寡斷。

sentences.english: Hamlet is usually played as a sorrowful person who cannot make decisions or take action.
sentences.chinese: 哈姆雷特常被演成一個優柔寡斷的傷感型人物。

sentences.english: Indecision can also result in missed opportunities.
sentences.chinese: 優柔寡斷還可以導致痛失良機。

sentences.english: Indecision is the enemy of action.
sentences.chinese: 優柔寡斷是行動的天敵。

sentences.english: Hoover’s indecisiveness handed his successor a triumph at the very start of his presidency.
sentences.chinese: 胡佛的優柔寡斷讓他的繼任得以在履新伊始旗開得勝。

sentences.english: An indecisive mind will always pick up on drawbacks of decisions.
sentences.chinese: 一位優柔寡斷的思維總是留意決定的缺點。

sentences.english: His opponents were too irresolute to call his bluff.
sentences.chinese: 他的對手太優柔寡斷，不敢接受挑戰。

sentences.english: Tom is so infirm of purpose that it is useless to ask him for advice.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆這人優柔寡斷，向他徵求意見是徒勞無益的。
是誰優柔寡斷且不斷變化。

sentences.english: Numb, battered, he balanced on the knife-edge of indecision.
sentences.chinese: 麻木的，累壞了的，他站在這刀鋒似的優柔寡斷上面。

definition: to like to look good in the eyes of others/sensitive about how one is regarded by others/proud
man of Qǐ fears the sky falling (idiom); groundless fears
lit. lotus roots may break, but the fiber remains joined (idiom); lovers part, but still long for one another
to make trouble without reason (idiom); to be deliberately provocative
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
